Interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode

All Superinterfaces:

All Known Implementing Classes:

public interface EARMARKHierarchicalNode
extends EARMARKNode

Method Detail

getChildElements

Collection getChildElements()
This method return all the child elements of the node.

Returns:
a collection containing all the child elements of the node.

hasElementNodes

boolean hasElementNodes()
This method says whether the node is a collection containing elements.

Returns:
true if the node sequence contain at least an element, false otherwise.

removeAllChild

EARMARKChildNode removeAllChild(EARMARKChildNode oldChild)
Remove the all the child node indicated by oldChild from the collection of children of the node, and returns it.

Parameters:
oldChild - the node being removed.
Returns:
the node removed.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] oldChild was created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

removeChildByOccurrence

EARMARKChildNode removeChildByOccurrence(EARMARKChildNode oldChild,
                                         int occurrence)
Remove the child node by occurrence indicated by oldChild from the collection of children of the node, and returns it.

Parameters:
oldChild - the node being removed.
occurrence - the node occurrence to remove.
Returns:
the node removed.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] oldChild was created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

replaceAllChild

EARMARKChildNode replaceAllChild(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                                 EARMARKChildNode oldChild)
                                 throws EARMARKGraphException
Replace the all child node oldChild with newChild in the collection of children of the node, and returns the oldChild node. If the oldChild does not exist, it returns null.

Parameters:
newChild - the new node to put in the child collection.
oldChild - the node being replaced in the collection.
Returns:
the node replaced or null if it does not exist.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] ewChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

replaceChildByOccurrence

EARMARKChildNode replaceChildByOccurrence(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                                          EARMARKChildNode oldChild,
                                          int occurrence)
                                          throws EARMARKGraphException
Replace the child node by occurrence indicated by oldChild from the list of children of 'node', and returns it.

Parameters:
newChild - the new node to put in the child collection.
oldChild - the node being replaced.
occurrence - the node occurrence to replace.
Returns:
the node replaced.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] node, newChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of node.

appendChild

EARMARKChildNode appendChild(EARMARKChildNode newChild)
                             throws EARMARKGraphException
Add the node newChild to the end of the sequence of the node.

Parameters:
newChild - the node to add.
Returns:
the node added.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if newChild was created from a different document than the one that created this node.

getChildNodes

Collection getChildNodes()
This method returns a collection that contains all children (elements, attributes, comments) of this node. If there are no children, this is a collection containing no nodes.

Returns:
the node children.

getAttributes

Collection getAttributes()
This method returns a collection that contains all the attributes of this node. If there are no children, this is a collection containing no nodes.

Returns:
the attribute children.

getComments

Collection getComments()
This method returns a collection that contains all the comments of this node. If there are no children, this is a collection containing no nodes.

Returns:
the comment children.

getFirstChild

EARMARKChildNode getFirstChild()
The first child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null. If the current node is a bag or a set, a random node is returned.

Returns:
the first node child.

getLastChild

EARMARKChildNode getLastChild()
The last child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null. If the current node is a bag or a set, a random node is returned.

Returns:
the last node child.

hasAttribute

boolean hasAttribute()
Returns whether this node has any attributes.

Returns:
true if this node has any attributes, false otherwise.

hasChildNodes

boolean hasChildNodes()
Returns whether this node has any children.

Returns:
true if this node has any children, false otherwise.

insertBefore

EARMARKChildNode insertBefore(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                              EARMARKChildNode refChild)
                              throws EARMARKGraphException
Inserts the node newChild before the first existing child node refChild of the node. If refChild is null, insert newChild at the end of the list of children. This operation makes sense if and only if the EARMARK node is a markup item and its type is Collection.Type.Sequence.

Parameters:
newChild - the node to insert.
refChild - the reference node, i.e., the node before which the new node must be inserted.
Returns:
the node being inserted.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] newChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

insertBefore

EARMARKChildNode insertBefore(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                              EARMARKChildNode refChild,
                              int occurrence)
                              throws EARMARKGraphException
Inserts the node newChild before the existing child node by occurrence refChild of the node. If refChild is null, insert newChild at the end of the list of children. This operation makes sense if and only if the EARMARK node is a markup item and its type is Collection.Type.Sequence.

Parameters:
newChild - the node to insert.
refChild - the reference node, i.e., the node before which the new node must be inserted.
occurrence - the occurrence of the refChild to consider.
Returns:
the node being inserted.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] newChild or refChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of the node.

removeChild

EARMARKChildNode removeChild(EARMARKChildNode oldChild)
                             throws EARMARKGraphException
This method removes the first child node indicated by oldChild from the list of children of the node, and returns it.

Parameters:
oldChild - the node being removed.
Returns:
the node removed.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] oldChild was created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of node.

replaceChild

EARMARKChildNode replaceChild(EARMARKChildNode newChild,
                              EARMARKChildNode oldChild)
                              throws EARMARKGraphException
Replace the first child node oldChild with newChild in the collection of children of the node, and returns the oldChild node. If oldChild does not exist, it returns null.

Parameters:
newChild - the new node to put in the child collection.
oldChild - the node being replaced in the collection.
Returns:
the node replaced or null if it does not exist.
Throws:
EARMARKGraphException - if [WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR] node, newChild or oldChild were created from a different document than this one or if [NOCHILD_ERR] refChild is not a child of node.

isList

boolean isList()
This method says whether the EARMARK node is a list or not.

Returns:
true if the node is a list, false otherwise.

isBag

boolean isBag()
This method says whether the EARMARK node is a bag or not.

Returns:
true if the node is a bag, false otherwise.

isSet

boolean isSet()
This method says whether the EARMARK node is a set or not.

Returns:
true if the node is a set, false otherwise.
